verses.text: So the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* and \w Haman|strong="H2001"\w* \w came|strong="H0935"\w* to \w banquet|strong="H8354"\w* with \w Esther|strong="H0635"\w* the \w queen|strong="H4436"\w*.\f + \fr 7.1 \ft to banquet: Heb. to drink\f*

And the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* again unto \w Esther|strong="H0635"\w* on the \w second|strong="H8145"\w* \w day|strong="H3117"\w* at the \w banquet|strong="H4960"\w* of \w wine|strong="H3196"\w*, What \add is\add* thy \w petition|strong="H7596"\w*, \w queen|strong="H4436"\w* \w Esther|strong="H0635"\w*? and it shall be \w granted|strong="H5414"\w* thee: and what \add is\add* thy \w request|strong="H1246"\w*? and it shall be \w performed|strong="H6213"\w*, \add even\add* to the \w half|strong="H2677"\w* of the \w kingdom|strong="H4438"\w*.

Then \w Esther|strong="H0635"\w* the \w queen|strong="H4436"\w* \w answered|strong="H6030"\w* and \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, If I have \w found|strong="H4672"\w* \w favour|strong="H2580"\w* in thy \w sight|strong="H5869"\w*, O \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, and if it \w please|strong="H2895"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, let my \w life|strong="H5315"\w* be \w given|strong="H5414"\w* me at my \w petition|strong="H7596"\w*, and my \w people|strong="H5971"\w* at my \w request|strong="H1246"\w*:

For we are \w sold|strong="H4376"\w*, I and my \w people|strong="H5971"\w*, to be \w destroyed|strong="H8045"\w*, to be \w slain|strong="H2026"\w*, and to \w perish|strong="H0006"\w*. But \w if|strong="H0432"\w* we had been \w sold|strong="H4376"\w* for \w bondmen|strong="H5650"\w* and \w bondwomen|strong="H8198"\w*, I had held my \w tongue|strong="H2790"\w*, although the \w enemy|strong="H6862"\w* could not \w countervail|strong="H7737"\w* the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w damage|strong="H5143"\w*.\f + \fr 7.4 \ft to be destroyed…: Heb. that they should destroy, and kill, and cause to perish\f*

¶ Then the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w Ahasuerus|strong="H0325"\w* \w answered|strong="H0559"\w* and \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto \w Esther|strong="H0635"\w* the \w queen|strong="H4436"\w*, Who is he, and where is he, that durst \w presume|strong="H4390"\w* in his \w heart|strong="H3820"\w* to \w do|strong="H6213"\w* so?\f + \fr 7.5 \ft that…: Heb. whose heart hath filled him\f*

And \w Esther|strong="H0635"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, The \w adversary|strong="H0376"\w* and \w enemy|strong="H0341"\w* \add is\add* this \w wicked|strong="H7451"\w* \w Haman|strong="H2001"\w*. Then \w Haman|strong="H2001"\w* was \w afraid|strong="H1204"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* and the \w queen|strong="H4436"\w*.\f + \fr 7.6 \ft The adversary: Heb. The man adversary\f*\f + \fr 7.6 \ft before: or, at the presence of\f*

¶ And the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w arising|strong="H6965"\w* from the \w banquet|strong="H4960"\w* of \w wine|strong="H3196"\w* in his \w wrath|strong="H2534"\w* \add went\add* into the \w palace|strong="H1055"\w* \w garden|strong="H1594"\w*: and \w Haman|strong="H2001"\w* stood \w up|strong="H5975"\w* to make \w request|strong="H1245"\w* for his \w life|strong="H5315"\w* to \w Esther|strong="H0635"\w* the \w queen|strong="H4436"\w*; for he \w saw|strong="H7200"\w* that there was \w evil|strong="H7451"\w* \w determined|strong="H3615"\w* against him by the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*.

Then the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w returned|strong="H7725"\w* out of the \w palace|strong="H1055"\w* \w garden|strong="H1594"\w* into the \w place|strong="H1004"\w* of the \w banquet|strong="H4960"\w* of \w wine|strong="H3196"\w*; and \w Haman|strong="H2001"\w* was \w fallen|strong="H5307"\w* upon the \w bed|strong="H4296"\w* whereon \w Esther|strong="H0635"\w* \add was\add*. Then \w said|strong="H0559"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, Will he \w force|strong="H3533"\w* the \w queen|strong="H4436"\w* also before me in the \w house|strong="H1004"\w*? As the \w word|strong="H1697"\w* went \w out|strong="H3318"\w* of the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w mouth|strong="H6310"\w*, they \w covered|strong="H2645"\w* \w Haman’s|strong="H2001"\w* \w face|strong="H6440"\w*.\f + \fr 7.8 \ft before me: Heb. with me\f*

And \w Harbonah|strong="H2726"\w*, \w one|strong="H0259"\w* of the \w chamberlains|strong="H5631"\w*, \w said|strong="H0559"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, Behold also, the \w gallows|strong="H6086"\w* \w fifty|strong="H2572"\w* \w cubits|strong="H0520"\w* \w high|strong="H1364"\w*, which \w Haman|strong="H2001"\w* had \w made|strong="H6213"\w* for \w Mordecai|strong="H4782"\w*, who had \w spoken|strong="H1696"\w* \w good|strong="H2896"\w* for the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, \w standeth|strong="H5975"\w* in the \w house|strong="H1004"\w* of \w Haman|strong="H2001"\w*. Then the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, \w Hang|strong="H8518"\w* him thereon.\f + \fr 7.9 \ft gallows: Heb. tree\f*

So they \w hanged|strong="H8518"\w* \w Haman|strong="H2001"\w* on the \w gallows|strong="H6086"\w* that he had \w prepared|strong="H3559"\w* for \w Mordecai|strong="H4782"\w*. Then was the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w wrath|strong="H2534"\w* \w pacified|strong="H7918"\w*.
